familySet.name: Family Phrases
phrases: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog
I love Anya Feng

anaesthesiaSet.name: Anaesthesia Exam Phrases
phrases: Haemodynamically stable throughout
Adequate depth of anaesthesia maintained
End-tidal CO₂ within normal limits
Peripheral oxygen saturation remained > 96% on FiO₂ 0.4
BIS monitoring used to titrate depth of anaesthesia
Difficult airway anticipated due to Mallampati grade IV
C-MAC video laryngoscope used for intubation
Cricoid pressure applied during rapid sequence induction
Arterial line inserted under aseptic technique
Induced with propofol, fentanyl, and rocuronium
Maintenance with sevoflurane in 50% oxygen/air mix
Ondansetron 4 mg IV given for antiemesis
Sugammadex 200 mg administered for reversal of neuromuscular blockade
Infusion of remifentanil titrated to effect
Co-amoxiclav 1.2 g IV given as prophylactic antibiotic
Paracetamol and parecoxib administered for multimodal analgesia
Ultrasound-guided transverse abdominis plane (TAP) block performed using 20 mL of 0.25% levobupivacaine
Spinal anaesthesia with 0.5% hyperbaric bupivacaine and 25 mcg fentanyl
Epidural catheter sited at L3–L4, secured with sterile dressing
Loss-of-resistance technique used with saline to identify epidural space
No evidence of laryngospasm or bronchospasm
Postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) risk stratified as high
Latex allergy documented – all equipment confirmed latex-free
Difficult venous access – ultrasound-guided cannulation required
Anaesthetic plan discussed with patient and consent obtained
